question: I had a challenging interaction with a client from a diverse background who felt their cultural values were not respected. How can I ensure that clients from diverse backgrounds feel valued and respected?
context: Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy V01_2208 30/08/2022 29/08/2024 Responsibilities and delegations Record of procedure development Version Date of Approved Date for Review This procedure applies to Specific responsibilities Procedure approval All staff All staff Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy Policy Hope Holistic Care is committed to: • ensuring a supportive workplace that respects and values diversity of customs, cultures and beliefs • ensuring that its services are delivered in a manner that respects and values the customs, cultures and beliefs of its clients • preventing harassment or discrimination of any kind Procedures Hope Holistic Care has developed a cultural diversity strategy that ensures that: • diversity and cultural inclusion are incorporated into the organisation’s orientation (for both staff and members of the Board). • staff will receive training and education in cultural competency and safety, and how to incorporate these into organisational values, practices, policies and service delivery • it will encourage the active recruitment of Chinese speaking staff from diverse backgrounds that are suitable for the clients of HHC. • information on the services and programs is available in Chinese • Active consultation involving people from diverse cultural and linguistic and backgrounds in identifying and prioritising needs and in planning service • changes to local cultural and linguistic demographics are reviewed in planning for future services • access to policies and procedures are reviewed on a regular basis to ensure there are no barriers to people from cultural or linguistically diverse backgrounds • harassment or discrimination are not tolerated and that appropriate internal organisation and/or legal protocols, are followed to prevent or address harassment or discrimination • flexible approaches are adopted in response to clients that recognises and meet cultural and linguistic needs Hope Holistic Care will ensure that its staff will: • demonstrate respect for cultural or religious customs and health practices including beliefs and taboos • be able to communicate in a language that the client will understand • when conducting an assessment for clients from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds they should be conducted in a manner that is culturally appropriate and respectful. This may also include using accredited interpreters where required, or involvement of a larger group of extended family members identified by the client • actively seek information from clients or where appropriate their family/carer about their customs, culture and beliefs where it may affect the provision of service. (e.g. culturally appropriate diet preferences, or religious rituals or the need for staff to be of the same gender as the client) • attempt to meet specific requests from clients, where possible, to demonstrate respect for Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy _POL_V01_2208 1|Page Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy the client (e.g. assistance in religious practices or help with establishing social networks) • ensure where possible and if appropriate, that clients have access to staff (within the organisation and external services) from similar cultural or linguistic backgrounds Definitions Cultural diversity and cultural inclusion refers to creating and maintaining a workplace and culture that is respectful of all people. In particular this applies to: • Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people • People from non-English speaking backgrounds • People from diverse racial, religious or cultural backgrounds • People with a disability • Gay, Lesbian, Transgender/gender diverse, Bisexual or Intersex people Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy _POL_V01_2208 2|Page
response: To ensure that clients from diverse backgrounds feel valued and respected, it's important to follow the guidance set out in the Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy [Diversity_and_Cultural_Inclusion_POL_V01_2208]. Here are some key steps you can take: Demonstrate Respect: Show respect for cultural or religious customs and health practices, including beliefs and taboos【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Cultural Competency Training: Make sure you have received training in cultural competency, and understand how to incorporate these into organizational values and service delivery【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Active Consultation: Engage actively with the client to understand their cultural and linguistic needs, such as dietary preferences, religious practices, or requirements for care provider gender【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Assessment and Communication: Ensure that assessments for clients from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds are conducted in a manner that is culturally appropriate and respectful; use accredited interpreters if needed【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Staff Diversity: Whenever possible and appropriate, provide access to staff from similar cultural or linguistic backgrounds【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Information Accessibility: Confirm that information on services and programs is available in the client's language, if necessary【0†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. Additionally, you should always follow the Client Rights Policy [Client_Rights_POL_V01_2208] to support the legal and human rights of clients to exercise those rights, including the right to be treated with dignity and respect, to have their identity, culture, and diversity valued and supported, and to receive care and services in an environment free from discrimination【3†policy.json†file-96qq8m41DnQwRSDjyLotuSoL】. By incorporating these policies into your daily practice, you can create a more inclusive and respectful environment for all clients, regardless of their cultural background.

response: To ensure that clients with limited English proficiency are fully informed of their rights and are able to make informed decisions about their care, you can utilize several tools and strategies as outlined in Hope Holistic Care's policies: Cultural Competency Training for Staff: Ensure that staff have received training in cultural competency, which includes the ability to communicate effectively with clients who have limited English proficiency【0†Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy】. Use of Accredited Interpreters: Consider using accredited interpreters where required to assist in communication during assessments and when providing information about services and programs to the client【0†Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy】. Actively Seek Client's Preferences: Actively seek information from clients about their customs, culture, and beliefs, which can affect the provision of service, and ensure that this information is understood and respected【2†Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy】. Provision of Information in Client's Language: Provide information on services and programs in the client's language, and, where appropriate, ensure that clients have access to staff from similar cultural or linguistic backgrounds【0†Diversity and Cultural Inclusion Policy】. Recording Client Preferences: Document all input from clients regarding their service preferences on their files to ensure their preferences are understood and followed【8†Decision Making, Choice and Dignity of Risk Policy】. Supported Decision-Making: Offer support necessary for clients to make, communicate, and participate in decisions regarding their life and care. This may include providing policy information in a format that clients from a non-English speaking background can understand【8†Decision Making, Choice and Dignity of Risk Policy】. Accessible Service Charter: Utilize the Client Service Charter, which outlines clients' rights and responsibilities in a way that is accessible and easily understood by clients. This charter can be provided at the commencement of services and explained if necessary . By implementing these strategies, you can enhance communication and ensure that clients with limited English proficiency have the necessary support to understand and assert their rights within the care provided by Hope Holistic Care. If there's uncertainty or if the client requires additional support, consult with your supervisor or refer to the relevant policies directly for further guidance.
